questions.question: For people who haven't read any of the books that we were just discussing, what would you recommend?
And maybe also just elaborate what mindset should they enter the reading of that book with?
Maybe one question I just wanna ask is, why is there such a opposition to Ayn Rand?
And maybe another way to ask the same thing is, what's misunderstood about Ayn Rand?
So one of the things you do when you want to do something is what is an ideal man?
And what does reason require in order to be successful, in order to work effectively?
Why don't I get to make that choice if I want to take on the 10% risk of heart disease?
Well, one interesting little side question there is what is the natural state of being for us humans?
I guess the question is like, how do we get here and how do we get out of that?
What would I be without the people who support me, who help me, who I have these love relationships with?
How many of you think that, that if you did that consistently, that would make your life better?
